result.execSummary:
The defendant Gerri L. Simons was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is to contact Probation Office in Portage, WI by 4pm today

miscConds.notes: Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge

No use or possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription 
Comply with and complete any and all counseling or treatment as recommended by the Agent 
Random drug and alcohol screens as recommended by Agent
Credit = 6 days (if revoked)
Cash bond to be applied; balance to be returned to party that posted it

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gerri L. Simons

records.addlTxt: to Withdraw as Counsel

Atty Watts states that the defendant will be waiving the Prelim today.   Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees with the waiver.  Court accepts the waiver of the Prelim.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.

Atty Burdon filed the information electronically with the Court and emailed a copy to counsel.  Atty Watts received a copy of the information and waives its reading. Court advises defendant of maximum penalties.  Defendant understands.

11:54 AM Defendant Gerri L. Simons appeared by phone.  Attorney Saralinda R Watts appeared by video for Gerri L. Simons.  Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Watts states that the matter is resolved but they will have to do a Prelim waiver first.  Court questions the defendant regarding in-person appearance.  Defendant waives their in-person appearance today & will proceed by zoom. 

Atty Burdon states plea agreement to Count 2.  Counts 1 & 3 to be dismissed and read-in.  

Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Defendant enters a No Contest plea.  
Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  

BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds the defendant guilty of Count 2 and orders the judgment of conviction as of today's date. 
Counts 1 & 3 to be dismissed and read-in.

Atty Burdon makes sentencing recommendations.
Atty Watts makes sentencing arguments.

BY THE COURT:  Count 2:  Withhold Sentence; 36 months Probation with conditions:
*Court Costs = $268.00
*Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge of $250.00
*AODA and any follow-up treatment
*No use or possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription
*Random drug and alcohol screens as recommended by the Agent
*Comply with and complete any and all counseling or treatment recommended by the Agent
Credit = 6 days (if revoked)
Cash bond to be applied; balance to be returned to the party that posted it.
**Court advises defendant that they have been convicted of a Felony and advises rights of voting privileges and of owning a firearm. 

Defendant is to contact the Probation office in Portage, WI by 4:00pm today 

Counts 1 & 3 to be dismissed and read-in.

2:05 PM Prosecuting attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Gerri L. Simons in court.  Attorney Saralinda R Watts appeared by video for Gerri L. Simons. 
Atty Watts was in contact with Treatment Court and they are going to assess her today or tomorrow.  Atty Watts requests a Plea/Sentencing date.  Ms. Simons had the assessment done today.

BY THE COURT:  Set status
bond continued
Status hearing scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Status hearing on September 19, 2022 at 11:30 am.

2:07 PM Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Gerri L. Simons appeared by phone.  Attorney Saralinda R Watts appeared by video for Gerri L. Simons. 
Atty Watts states an offer was received.  Requests her client be assessed for treatment court.  Atty Burdon makes statement.
BY THE COURT:  Defendant to follow up with Ms. Schlotte.  Reset.
Status hearing scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Status hearing on August 15, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

10:36 AM Prosecuting attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Gerri L. Simons appeared by phone.  Attorney Saralinda R Watts appeared by video for Gerri L. Simons. 
Court confirms address.  Atty Watts states that he and the Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading. Atty Watts states that the defendant waives time limits for the Prelim.  Defendant agrees.
Court advises defendant of maximum penalties.  Defendant understands. 

BY THE COURT:  Defendant waives time limits for the preliminary hearing. 
bond continued
Status hearing scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Status hearing on July 25, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
and Motion for Time to File Additional Pretrial Motions

records.addlTxt:
10:37 AM Prosecuting attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Gerri L. Simons appeared by phone. 
Defendant did call the Public Defender's office and she was told she qualified but they couldn't appear today.

BY THE COURT:  Reset
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 20, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on June 20, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:14 AM Prosecuting attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Gerri L. Simons in court. 
Defendant spoke with the Public Defender office in Portage and she thought that she would have someone today.  

BY THE COURT:  Reset one more time so the defendant can contact the Public Defender office.
Defendant is to call before she leaves the courthouse
bond continued
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on June 6, 2022 at 10:00 am.
of warrant cancellation
Return on warrant
Defendant appeared in court

3:42 PM Defendant Gerri L. Simons in court.  Attorney Cliff Burdon in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court questions the defendant as to why she failed to appear yesterday.  Defendant states that she had truck troubles and couldn't get here.

BY THE COURT:  Warrant quashed
Cash bond will be reinstated

Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint and waives the reading.  Court advises defendant of maximum penalties.  Defendant understands. Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands and states that she has a public defender in Columbia County.

BY THE COURT:  Set for AIA
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on May 23, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Return on warrant on May 3, 2022 at 03:15 pm.

10:35 AM Defendant Gerri L. Simons not in court.  Attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Juech requests warrant based on defendant's failure to appear and asks that the cash bail be forfieted.

BY THE COURT:  Warrant will issue; Cash bond to be forfieted.
*No use or possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription

3:18 PM Defendant Gerri L. Simons appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Cliff Burdon appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.  Court confirms address and phone. 
Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands and has an Attorney for another case in a different county.
Court finds probable cause for the charges for Riverside purposes. 

Atty Burdon requests a $1,000 cash bond with conditions.
Defendant wants to accept the offer that was provided.  

BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $1,000 Cash bond with conditions: 
*No use or possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription
Initial appearance scheduled for May 2, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Initial appearance on May 2, 2022 at 10:00 am.
